snippet: Baby boomers say they want to stay in the work force past retirement age, a time that will coincide with increases in certain taxes and may cut into Social Security benefits.
abstract: Financial advisers say that more than ever, people who are considering staying in the work force past retirement age need a life plan to account for living expenses, health, tax, investment and estate issues; urgency is compounded by significant tax changes scheduled to take effect in 2013.
lead_paragraph: Baby boomers say they want to stay in the work force past retirement age, a time that will coincide with increases in certain taxes and may cut into Social Security benefits.

headline.seo: Tax Changes Ahead Call for Planning Now
headline.main: With Tax Changes Near, ‘You Can’t Wait to Plan’
headline.print_headline: With Tax Changes Near, ‘You Can’t Wait to Plan’
